definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania/abbr. to 費城|费城[Fei4 cheng2]
pinyin: Fei4 la1 de2 er3 fei1 ya4

sentences.english: He had offered the loan of his small villa at Cap Ferrat.
sentences.chinese: 他願意借出在費拉角的小別墅。

sentences.english: Confirming reports over the past few days, Juventus have officially appointed Ciro Ferrara as their coach for next season.
sentences.chinese: 尤文官方宣佈費拉拉出任下賽季球隊主教練。

sentences.english: Mrs. Ferrars can never forget that Edward is her son.
sentences.chinese: 費拉斯太太決不會忘記愛德華是她的兒子。

sentences.english: The Fila 's head is heavy and massive, always proportionate to the body.
sentences.chinese: 費拉犬的頭很大很有質量，但會與其身體成比例。

sentences.english: In a few days, Marius had become Courfeyrac's friend.
sentences.chinese: 沒過幾天，馬呂斯便成了古費拉克的朋友。

sentences.english: It seemed to him that Courfeyrac was speaking Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 他聽起來以爲古費拉克在說中國話。

sentences.english: Albufeira Old Town encompasses the historical points of interest in the area.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾布費拉老城包括在該地區利益的歷史點。

sentences.english: It chanced that in the Rue de la Verrerie, they passed in front of Courfeyrac's door.
sentences.chinese: 進入玻璃廠街，他們從古費拉克的門前走過。

sentences.english: Nurse with children in Moscow. Children in Vladimir.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科，費拉米爾，護士與孩子們。

sentences.english: At that moment, Courfeyrac emerged from the cafe.
sentences.chinese: 這時，古費拉克從咖啡館裏走出來。

sentences.english: Courfeyrac, you will see the polytechnic students.
sentences.chinese: 古費拉克，你去看看綜合工科學校的那些同學。

sentences.english: It is official. Ciro Ferrara is the new coach of Juventus.
sentences.chinese: 費拉拉正式成爲尤文的主教練。

sentences.english: The digitisation of the Ferrari 250MM showed up to be critical under a number of aspects.
sentences.chinese: 費拉里化的厚的出現是在若干重要方面。

sentences.english: Bossuet had gone down to meet Courfeyrac.
sentences.chinese: 博須埃下樓找古費拉克去了。
是啊，我的好古費拉克先生。

definition: fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
to stake all on one throw
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
